Race.SpecificTitle: Constable -- Justice of the Peace Ward B
Constable -- Justice of the Peace Ward C
Constable -- Justice of the Peace Ward J
PW HRC Amend. Art. II, Sect. 2-06(a) -- PC - Art. II, Sect. 2-06(a)
Race.SummaryText: Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall Article II, Section 2-06(a) of the Home Rule Charter of the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana, be amended to read as follows: (a) A council member shall hold no other elected public office, appointed position in government service, or be a compensated official or employee of the parish government or any of its political subdivisions during the term for which elected to the council.  However, council members may hold the positions of notary public, an officer in the military service, a member of a charter commission, a delegate to a constitutional convention, or a member of a political party committee.  No former council member shall hold any compensated appointive office or employment of the parish government or any of its political subdivisions until one (1) year after expiration of the term of office to which elected?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PC Prop #1 (Libraries) -- 1.23 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a special tax of one and twenty-three hundredths (1.23) mills on all property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $380,990 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of constructing, maintaining, improving and operating public libraries in the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PC Prop #2 (Libraries) -- 2.47 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a special tax of two and forty-seven hundredths (2.47) mills on all property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $765,077 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2020 and ending with the year 2029, for the purpose of constructing, maintaining, improving and operating public libraries in the Parish and for purchasing books and other library materials therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PC Prop #3 (Recreation) -- 2.17 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a special tax of two and seventeen hundredths (2.17) mills on all property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $672,153 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of acquiring or improving lands, building and equipment for recreation purposes, title to which shall be in the public, and maintaining and operating such recreation facilities in the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PC Prop #4 (Health Unit & Coroner) -- .62 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 4
(Millage Rededication-Health Unit & Coroner)
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy a special tax of sixty-two hundredths (.62) mills (the "Tax"), authorized at an election on November 7, 2006, on all property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $192,044 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for an additional period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, with the proceeds of the Tax heretofore or hereafter collected, to be rededicated and used for: (i) constructing, maintaining, improving and operating public health units in the Parish and/or (ii) providing funding for the St. Bernard Parish Coroner's Office, including constructing, acquiring, improving, operating and maintaining facilities and equipment therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PC Prop #5 (Council On Aging) -- .94 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 5
(Millage Renewal-Council On Aging)
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a special tax of ninety-four hundredths (.94) mills on all property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $291,163 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of providing funding for senior citizens programs, activities and services operated by the Parish and/or the St. Bernard Parish Council on Aging?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Garbage Dist. No. 1 -- 3.05 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Garbage District No. 1 Proposition
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Garbage District No. 1 of the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of three and five hundredths (3.05) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $944,731 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of providing and maintaining garbage collection and disposal services in the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Road Dist. No. 1 -- 3.05 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Road District No. 1 Proposition
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Road District No. 1 of the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of three and five hundredths (3.05) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $944,731 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of constructing, improving and maintaining public roads and highways in the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Road Lighting Dist. No. 1 -- 3 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Road Lighting District No. 1 Proposition
(In-Lieu Millage)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. 1 of the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of three (3) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $917,136 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, for the purpose of providing and maintaining electric lights on the streets, roads, highways, alleys and public places in the District, said millage, if approved, to be levied in lieu of and replace an existing one and twenty-three hundredths (1.23) mills tax authorized to be levied in the District through the year 2016 at an election held on November 7, 2006?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Lake Borgne Basin Levee District -- 7.5 Mills - BOC - 30 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Lake Borgne Basin Levee District Proposition
(Millage)
Race.FullText: Shall the Lake Borgne Basin Levee District, Louisiana (the "District''), levy and collect a special ad valorem tax of seven and one-half (7.5) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $2,591,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of thirty (30) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2044, for the purpose of constructing and maintaining necessary levees, levee drainage, flood protection, hurricane flood protection and all other purposes incidental thereto which tax may be used as security for bonds or other evidences of indebtedness to be used to pay the costs of such projects?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist. No. 1 Prop No. 1 -- 2.73 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 1 Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of two and seventy-three hundredths (2.73) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $670,353 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and services in the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist. No. 1 Prop No. 2 -- 4.60 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 1 Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of four and sixty hundredths (4.60) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $1,129,533 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019 and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining, improving and operating fire protection facilities and purchasing fire trucks and other fire fighting equipment in the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 2 -- 8.14 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 2 Proposition
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 2 of the Parish of St. Bernard, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of eight and fourteen hundredths (8.14) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $519,246 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019 and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining, improving and operating fire protection facilities and purchasing fire trucks and other fire fighting equipment in the District?
